title: Powell Clayton
added: | publisher = The University of Oklahoma Press

title: Powell Clayton
added: Clayton was elected to the U.S. Senate for Arkansas in March 1871 and controversy followed him there.  A U.S. Senate Joint Select Committee investigated him for claims made by his political rivals that he inappropriately authorized election results from contested polling locations. He was acquitted of these charges and moved back to Arkansas after losing his Senate seat in 1877 after Democrats took control of the Arkansas legislature.
